column3: I ordered from this place for a large lunch. I ordered for about 15 people for a 12pm delivery and everything was on time. When the delivery guy arrived he had trouble finding the spot but he found it. He set up everything but they were missing plates they were supposed to include

column3: Very good food! I ordered late night and the food came very warm and packaged nicely. The toasted marshmallow milkshake is AMAZING! Hefty price tag for some grilled cheese sandwiches but that's the beauty of delivery apps and restaurants I also enjoyed the promo code they gave for $10 off my first delivery order through them!Overall 4/5
This business is doing something that seems really shady
column4: and people should know.  On the food apps
column5: Grubbs shows up as itself
column6: but ALSO as DIFFERENT names.  Henny Penny Chicken on Delivery
column7: and Junior's Diner on Seamless.  Considering the business gets the orders when they go through
column8: and the receipts show the business name
column9: I find it extremely likely that the business knows full well that a different business name is showing up on the order.All 3 names list 418 Washington St as the address

column15: I'm not opposed to ghost kitchens
column16: just the ghost kitchen should offer a unique experience entirely to the standard brick and mortar.  Otherwise
column17: if it's the same menu (food) with a different name
column18: that's just dishonest.  The food is ok
column19: which is why I gave 3 stars.  But if I order from a place
column20: I want my food to come from the place I expect

column3: If im being very straightforward. The burgers arent tasty. Very bland in taste and the patty is crumbly like a coffee cake. The bacon jam is decently made and the chipotle ketchup needs more chipotle than ketchup. Lastly the fries are cooked to be used with malt vinegar which they dont offer. They need to be crispier if theyre going for a fries and ketchup kind of deal.

column3: The red headed woman with the bun... give her a raise immediately!!! She is the hardest worker and has to put up with so much. I order dessert here every weekend and she is always on point

column3: Lowering my review after I used a delivery app to order from a restaurant called "Henny Penny" and it turned out to be a ghost kitchen for Grubbs. That means Grubb's has a fake restaurant called "Henny Penny" that they put on the apps to trick people into ordering from them. If I wanted Grubb's I would have ordered from there. Seems a bit dishonest. Of course the service was slow as usual. This made me lose trust with this place and I will likely not be back for a while if ever.

column8: which is like a better quality (and slightly bigger) version of McDonald's McChicken sammie. Everything is good here: the burgers
column10: the fries. And I know what you're thinking: everything is good when you're drunk
column11: but it's not like that. They always get the order to you in a timely fashion. I think I was once quoted a delivery of an hour
column12: but it came in less than half an hour. So thanks
column13: Grubbs - for lessening the blow of Saturday morning hangovers.

column3: Just ordered delivery here for the first and last time.. Took one bite and found TWO(2) hairs in my burger. One mushed into the top bun and one on the tomato. Called to get a refund and they only refunded me for a regular cheeseburger. Not the bacon cheeseburger with cheddar cheese which I paid more for. Always hear stories of hair in food and this is the first time experiencing it.
I've been wary of ordering from here because of the very low/mixed reviews. But Hoboken doesn't have a ton of I need a burger
column4: greasy food please cure my hangover takeaway spots (let alone what McDonalds and Johnny Rockets?). Grubbs is closer to my place and so I gave it a try.I ordered on Seamless and my food was ready for pickup 20 minutes later. I catered my burger toppings to my liking and everything came out correctly. The food did its job and was exactly what I wanted
column5: but I thought it was a tad expensive for what it was (burger and two sides totaled $19) and I'm still very wary of this place due to its mixed reviews. I actually even went through my bag outside the store to make sure everything was in there bc the delivery reviews are so bad. Worth noting
column6: there is no seating at this venue. It's truly only for carry out.If/when I become a regular I would consider updating my rating if this place became more consistent. For now truly I wish I could give this place a 3.5?

column3: This place has become hit or miss. It used to be amazing - not sure why such a decline. Ordered a chicken BLT wrap with sweet potato fries and asked for extra sauces and pickles on the side. I assumed my ranch and honey mustard would be in containers for dipping but instead both were sloppily smeared all over an already mess of a wrap. Fries were cold and they totally forgot my pickles. Had the nerve to credit me .65cents for the cost of the pickles upon complaining. Get it together

column12: all it takes is a place to do what they do WELL. Grubbs exceeds. You want a fast burger and fries
column13: Grubbs is where you'll get the best in Hoboken!- Chris

column3: Great when it's Saturday night

column3: Matt was freaking awesome! He asked us where we were from and was just a great guy overall! Definitely a great place!! The food was awesome! Will be going back again!!

column4: service was quick.

column3: It's really a take away spot. Not a lot of frills but I am happy with the food and the service. I have only ever had the burgers and fries to take away and the reviews are right the fries are awesome. I don't even need ketchup (and I love ketchup). I tried a cheese burger the first time around and it was good
column4: then I tried the double cheese burger and that was also good but it was a lot bigger than I thought so you might need to be really hungry to get that. I will eat there again.

column3: Very good food. I'd definitely recommend the burgers

column6: it's only a block away from Stevens which is nice since they take duckbills.

column3: Cheeseburger with mushrooms was absolutely excellent. So we're the sweet potato fries - definitely worth it! I ordered Grubbs because it was the only thing open late night but I'll probably do takeout more often because so far so great!

Did not receive order in specified time frame. Waited an hour then received a call that they hadn't even started to make my order yet and that it would take at least another half hour because they were short on drivers.. this would have been nice to know before I had already waited an hour..had to cancel since its already 9pm
column4: won't be ordering from here again. Not reliable..

column3: I'm a student at Stevens Institute of Technology down the block
column4: and this is my favorite spot in town. I'm sick of all the other places in town
column5: flatbread
column6: midtown steaks
column7: bennys
column8: etc. They all have no flavor and horrible service. Grubbs on the other hand has great food and employees. My favorite are the wings (best in hoboken by far (ask for them seasoned!)) And the workers taking my order like Karen and Matt are extremely nice. 5 stars for Grubbs!

column3: Stopped by for a late night burger. My order was taken incorrectly and I later realized I was overcharged. The staff was arguing in the background the entire time. The burger itself took longer than I would have thought given I was the only customer. The burger itself was fairly mediocre
column4: though I wouldn't call it a bad burger. I appreciate the late night hours (hard to find in uptown Hoboken after midnight)
column5: but I'd likely never return unless it was my only option.

column3: Love this joint! We always order in. Fast and delicious. Great burgers and crunchy fries.

Stumbled upon this place after we saw uber eats was charging a $16 booking fee for McDonalds (not proud of it). Grubbs was that good that I'm taking the time to write a review at 2am. Wasn't expecting much but we ordered a junior cheeseburger
column4: a crispy chicken sandwich and a honey Dijon sandwich with fries- everything was awesome. Fantastic quality for the price and quick delivery for so late at night. This will absolutely be my late night go-to.

column3: My wife and I picked up a cheeseburger
column4: grilled chicken sandwich
column5: regular fries
column6: and sweet potato fries as a Sunday Night "fun/cheat night"...everything was absolutely delicious
column7: and the service was extremely courteous.Rivals Midtown Philly Steaks for best fries in town.

column3: Delivery was timely and food was exactly what we ordered and tasty and well prepared. It will certainly be one of go to places for home delivery

I have been in the food industry all of my life. This place is an absolute mess. I gave it a few chances. Tonight they got my order completely wrong and told me they are going to remember my name and give me what I ordered next time around. If there was only going to be a next time. I will not be ordering from here anymore.
Love this place! I got a Cheesburger
column4: Fries
column5: and a Strawberry Oreo milkshake. Seriously
column6: to die for.

column3: The girlfriend and I have ordered from here a couple of times. Pretty quick delivery and the fries are on point. Definitely keeping this place in our late night rotation.

Came in here drunk with my friends.  We said a lot of stupid stuff and the staff remained calm and dealt with our bs.  Had a chili burger that hit the spot.  Their fries are fried differently and its nice. It was something different to try. I really like this place.  Keep it up! My friends got the cheeseburgers and really liked them.

Do not order cheese fries. Better off ordering fries and adding your own cheese when you get home. Legit only 8 fries were covered with cheese. Also ordered a root beer float and they give me a cup of ice cream filled to the top with no room to pour my root beer  well thanks for the cup of ice cream and a drink for later !!  Extremely expensive as well.  Where's 5 guys when you need them

Ordered delivery from here last night off Grubhub. Really tasty snack bar type junk food when you're having a craving. I got an egg sandwich and my boyfriend got the crispy chicken sandwich and both were great. Also got mozz sticks that were good and an Oreo milkshake which was divine. They also came more than 20 min early of the delivery estimate which was a pleasant surprise. Would definitely order again.
Came here the week after they opened and decided to give it some time before posting my review
column4: but subsequent comments from friends who have encountered the same issues I had confirmed my initial impression. I went here expecting to find a well priced
column5: high quality
column6: and filling burger. Upon entry we found that a double cheese burger costs over $12 (with tax). I ordered it
column7: thinking it must be a pretty great burger to charge that much more then any other burger place would
column8: but I was certainly mistaken. When we tried to order
column9: it took the employees close to 10 minutes to figure out how to work the POS system. When the order finally went through
column10: we saw the cooks peeling our small burger patties off of a sheet and tossing them lazily onto the grill. More confusion occurred when they tried to construct and bag our burgers
column11: and by the time we received our orders over 30 minutes had passed since we had ordered
column12: even though our party of two were the only patrons. While we waited
column13: there was no where to sit down
column14: since the place was meant for "Take-Away" and since there was inadequate ventilation in the restaurant it felt like it was well over 80° the whole time. For the insane prices they charge
column15: I'd expect these to be large
column19: but I was very disappointed at the overall quality and taste of the final product. The patties were tiny and tasted completely plain. I left hungry having spent over $12 dollars
column20: for which I could have bought two tremendous burgers at a Shake Shack. After this poor experience I certainly would not visit Grubbs again
column21: and many of my friends have told me that their visits there have been equally unpleasant.

column3: Excellent comfort food and very friendly and attentive staff. The owner has been there a couple of times and he's extremely welcoming. Many Hoboken businesses could learn something from him. I love the cheese steak and my son loves the burgers
column4: we both love the tater tots.  I hope these guys get lots of business and stick around.

column3: One of my new fav places! My faves include: Crispy chicken sandwich
column4: quarter pounder with cheese
column5: tater tots
column6: mozz sticks.   It's all good!   and the staff there are so friendly

column3: I ordered Grubbs Take Away for the first time tonight off off of Seamless. I was really excited to have this for dinner because I saw a lot of great reviews on yelp. I was prepping to leave Jersey City and head back to Philadelphia and was not in the mood to make dinner. We ordered our dinner at 6-6:15 pm and the app said that we would get our food delivered between 7:10-7:20. We normally get a message from Seamless when the food is on its way. When 7:25 hit and we had not received that message
column4: I checked the app and saw that it said our food had been delivered at 7:11 PM. I called Grubbs and the man who answered was very courteous and apologetic. He let me know that their app was messed up and whenever the food is leaving the restaurant it comes up as delivered on the recipient's phone. They told me that our food would be there within 10 minutes and it had been delayed because they received a rush of orders after ours. The food finally made it at 8 pm and while it was good food (fries were crispy-just how I like them!) it was disappointing because I was hoping to have left by then. The whole point of ordering from here was that it was supposed to be a simple and decently quick meal but that isn't what it turned out to be. While I appreciate the restaurant being nice when I called
column5: I wish they had just been honest and told me the food was going to take longer than expected
column6: not give me false hope that it was around the corner. Side note- if you order a sandwich
column7: you do not get chips or fries with it like you would at most restaurants. You have to order fries on their own!

column3: Unbelievably terrible experience here! I Order delivery. They confirm it and accept it. An hour and half later we call to find out where our order is... first there is something wrong with their tablet (I call bs on that because we received the text saying they accepted our order) THEN oh wait sorry we are out of bagels do you want a Kaiser roll?!? Ok so were you going to call me to let me know or just wait until I starved?????? Meanwhile I'm running late for an out of town errand and I've waited close to TWO HOURS!!!!! And now it's too late to get something else somewhere else so imagine my level of frustration when all they had to do was call and let me know. Then at least I didn't spend my time waiting and waiting for an order that was never even going to be made and delivered. Won't give this place a second chance!
Best late night delivery but also delicious over all. Never ate at restaurant but delivery is quick and delicious! I had the onion rings and tuna burger.
I never write reviews but I felt compelled to write one.  This was the first time I had ordered from this place.  Myself and several nurses ordered the spicy chicken sandwich
column4: french fries
column5: sweet potato fries
column6: breakfast sandwich
column7: and the 1/4 pounder.  First off- I messed up the order and called them to rectify and they did it without any issue whatsoever.  When the food came
column8: the owner came IN PERSON to introduce himself.  Clearly this place understands what good customer service means.Second- the food.  The spicy chicken sandwich reminded me of hot-fried chicken I've had in Nashville
column9: and I heard my nurses saying "SO GOOD" as they were eating their burgers.  The fries were everything I needed and more.  This is definitely our new night-shift spot!
